intro: Tinnea vesiculosa, commonly known as the blisterleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that often have a blistery or waxy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a small, spherical capsule that contains several seeds. Tinnea vesiculosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
